results.title: Music from Montreal
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Jones and David Bairstow
results.brief_description: A film about the Montreal Bach Choir and its dynamic director, George Little. The choir is heard at rehearsal and in excerpts from a performance of Bach’s Christmas Oratorio.

results.title: Music camp
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and R. Maslyn Williams
results.brief_description: Music students are able to attend a summer camp at Point Lonsdale, Victoria, for three weeks every year. This camp is organised by the National Fitness Council, the Founder being John Bishop. Students attend tutorial classes each morning in the open air and the afternoons are free to swim, fish, sunbathe and practice. In the evenings students usually give a concert for friends and visitors to the camp.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian National Film Board and R. Maslyn Williams

results.title: Music and architecture through the ages
results.brief_description: Glimpses of historic French buildings which have associations with various events in French history, together with remarks about the way in which musical instruments have been reproduced as motifs for decoration in architecture.

results.title: Mushrooms = Champignons
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Forget and Pierre Veilleux
results.brief_description: Mushrooms are deceiving. They can play tricks with your head. In this animation film, mushrooms are a powerful metaphor. Their metamorphosis suggests that life is a vast “food chain”. If this is indeed our reality, can we, the consumers, escape being consumed? A film that serves up a riveting “plat du jour”. Awards: Zagreb; Chicago

results.title: Mushroom 25 live: Telstra concert of the century
results.brief_description: On Saturday the 14th of November 1998, some of Australia’s most popular performers gathered to celebrate 25 years of the Mushroom recording label- thousands of fans representing a multitude of generations packed into the Melbourne Cricket Ground for the musical spectacular. This three video set features almost six hours of live performances by the greatest names in Australian music including: Moler, Machinations, Scott Carne, Painters & Dockers, Nick Barker, Paul Norton, Wendy Stapleton, Stars, Dynamic Hepnotics, The Badloves, Chain, Juno Roxus, Dave Warner, The Ferrets, Weddings Parties Anything, Chris Wilson, Wilson Diesel, Vika and Linda, Madder Lake, Chantoozies, James Freud, Swoop, Christie Allen, Uncanny X-Men, Dannii and Kylie Minogue, The Mavis’s, Deborah Conway, Archie Roach, Ruby Hunter, Mark Seymour, Chris Bailey, Paul Kelly, Renee Geyer, The Sports, Mick Molloy, Sunnyboys, Ol‘55, Billy Thorpe, Choirboys, Ian Moss, Kate Ceberano, Peter Andre, Deni Hines, Leonardo’s Bride, The Whitlams, The Angels, Jimmy Barnes, and INXS.

results.title: Museum Visitor
results.creator_credit: Gosko, ZSM Film Produktion, Channel 2 (ZDF) West Germany and Konstantin Lopushansky
results.brief_description: A remarkable fable warning of ecological catastrophe. Max decides to visit a museum on the bottom of the seabed, one which can only be reached during the seven-day low tide. What he finds while he waits, however, is a place reserved for mutants, victims of an ecological catastrophe.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gosko, ZSM Film Produktion, Channel 2 (ZDF) West Germany and Konstantin Lopushansky

results.title: Museum explains scientific progress
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and Museum of Applied Science
results.brief_description: Shows the displays and models of the Melbourne Museum of Applied Science. Stresses the craftsmanship which is applied to the explanatory models, such as those shown - the artificial moons and the rockets now probing into space.

results.title: Museum
results.creator_credit: Janus Films, Saul J. Turell and Jeff Lieberman
results.brief_description: This film looks at the work of staff in museums across the United States. The operation of a modern museum is shown: excavation, conservation, exhibition and education. Selected museum objects are shown being handled by professionals from acquisition to exhibition. The installation of the Tutankhamen exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art is shown.
